entry.title: Integrate the RemoveAll private api into Extension Safety Check.
entry.content:
This CL integrates the private API for removing multiple extensions into the extension

safety check review panel. The changes in this CL include:

- Adding a new handler to the existing service.ts file.

- Connecting the Remove All button callback function to the private API through

delegate/service.ts.

- Changing the hasChangeBeenMade_ flag based on the error message from the API, so

that clicking the Cancel button will not change the state.



Bug: 1432194

entry.title: [wpt-importer] Extend CQ+2 timeout from 30 min to 1h
entry.content:
`win-branded-compile-rel` is an internal builder that only runs on CQ+2,

meaning it doesn't reuse a CQ+1 build. The P90 runtime for this builder

is around 20-30 min, which is near the current importer timeout of 30

min. Bump up this timeout so that the importer does not prematurely

abandon unlucky CLs (e.g., crrev.com/c/4727817).



Bug: None

entry.title: bento_button: Fix crash for desk switch button tooltip
entry.content:
The crash occurs when the desk switch button tooltip appears during the

desk switch animation. The root cause is that we update the switch

buttons after the desk switch, which means the switch button may remain

visible for longer than expected.



To ensure that the switch buttons are valid throughout their lifetime,

the solution is to update them before the desk switch.



Bug: b/292257858

Test: Manual

entry.title: [User Education] fix WebUI help bubbles are sometimes too small
entry.content:
An element with internal wrapping text may be sized smaller than its

preferred or max width in Blink, unlike with a Views bubble. Because of

this, sometimes help bubbles in WebUI are visually too narrow.



Increase the minimum help bubble size to something a bit more sensible,

especially if a body icon is present.

entry.title: Ensure content analysis completes before printing document
entry.content:
When the PrintingContext starts printing a new document, it can cause a

file save dialog to be displayed to the user. It is important that this

does not happen while content analysis is still in progress, since the

printing operation might not be allowed.



Update the content analysis state change logic to ensure that there is

not a print job that has already started. While existing tests pass

this check, a new test to cover window.print() will need work to satisfy

this since that use case is generating a file save dialog for users.



Bug: 1464566

Change-Id: I7d478a442e313a1fefd422649efa8b202053e8cf

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Handle End-of-Stream during mid stream
entry.content:
ToT code doesn't support EOS midstream, only at the end. Such

operations are not very common in the wild, but are a necessary part

of midstream resolution changes (which are very common). To simplify

code review, this CL focuses on the first part, and adds a specific

test case for it in v_d_a_test.



Specifically, to support these EOS midstream:

- We add a SendStartCommand() to V4L2Queue, and use it.

- Two new methods are added to V4L2StatefulVD to reuse operations,

namely DrainOUTPUTQueue() and PrintOutQueueStatesForVLOG().

DrainOUTPUTQueue() is called during Decode() and also during the

final part of the Flush operation.



Tested via:



/usr/local/libexec/chrome-binary-tests/video_decode_accelerator_tests

/usr/local/share/tast/data_pushed/go.chromium.org/tast-tests/cros/local/bundles/cros/video/data/test-25fps.vp8

--vmodule=v4l2_stateful_video_decoder=3,*/media/gpu/v4l2/*=1,=0,video_decoder_pipeline=3

--enable-features=V4L2FlatStatefulVideoDecoder

--gtest_filter='*.FlushMidStream'



on hana and trogdor which are the only V4L2 stateful ChromeOS devices.



[1] https://www.kernel.org/doc/html/v5.15/userspace-api/media/v4l/dev-decoder.html#drain



Bug: b:279980150

entry.title: [Extensions] Work around dangling BrowserContext pointer.
entry.content:
WebRequestAPI binds a callback to some ExtensionWebRequestEventRouter

member functions and one of those parameters is a BrowserContext. It

then posts that callback to a SequenceTaskRunner.



However, it's possible for that BrowserContext to be destroyed before

the task runs, which would result in a UAF error when the caller uses

that BrowserContext. The fix is for the WebRequestAPI instance to

bind to new member functions that call through to the target

functions. This callback is then bound using a WeakPtr to prevent

the call if the BrowserContext is torn down. Additionally, the

forwarding functions check the validity of the BrowserContext before

forwarding the call.



This works because WebRequestAPI is a keyed service bound to the

lifetime of the BrowserContext and is destroyed before the

BrowserContext is.



Bug: 1453528, 1468177

entry.title: [A11y] Cleanup Android inline textbox code
entry.content:
Unlike other platforms that use inline text boxes, Android only loads them in two cases:

1. In focused editable subtrees

2. In subtrees where a kLoadInlineTextboxes action was received

Once inline text boxes have been loaded for a given text node, they will always be kept up-to-date and reserialized if they change.



This CL keeps the same behavior but refactors it, such that all required inline textboxes are loaded before serialization takes place. This allows Android to be compatible with the upcoming CL:4544997, which enhances our eager AX tree update enforcement by requiring all AXObject cached values are computed before serialization begins.

It also removes 50 lines of code, and cleans up the hack in BlinkAXTreeSource:GetChildCount().

entry.title: Generate low-entropy UA client hints if overrides UA in command-line
entry.content:
This cl changes the behavior of generating user-agent client hints when

user overrides user-agent in the command-line.



We only send blank user-agent metadata if kUACHOverrideBlank feature

turns on, otherwise, sending the default user-agent metadata with

low-entropy client hints.



For user-agent overrides, sending the blank UserAgentMetadata could cause requests being blocked by web application firewall, also, without sending user-agent client hints could cause compat issues because some Google services were expecting the sec-ch-ua* headers present.



If we provide options to override the low-entropy user-agent client hints from command-line, it could introduce heavy work to validate the inputs to avoid any unexpected failures, especially validate the brand-version list for client hints sec-ch-ua. Another option could be that we can only provide command-line override for sec-ch-ua-plaform and sec-ch-ua-mobile if users really needs to override user-agent metadata from command-line.

entry.title: Only attempt to preload database file if it already exists.
entry.content:
Previously, for the exclusive lock codepath, the database file

would be unconditionally preloaded.



However, if the file does not exist, then preload fails inside

the MemoryMappedFile::Initialize function, causing an ERROR

log to be generated that looks something like



[53680:67420:0727/163810.446:FATAL:memory_mapped_file.cc(61)] Couldn't open E:\src\Temp\scoped_dir74800_730462892\user_data\Default\Network\Cookies



This can be confusing as it's not really an error, so this CL

fixes the code so it never attempts to preload in this case.



This should be no behavior change, since it was never actually

preloading in this case but just erroring out.



BUG=1429117



Change-Id: I4e5fdc7f6c5a3163f00f9627fb1f28cc13105bf7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4727716

Commit-Queue: Will Harris

Reviewed-by: Austin Sullivan

entry.title: Revert "Register gtests written in Rust without Rust static initializers"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 756b975d4c851524cdb681fe841d74c521f58ee0.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection identified this CL as the culprit of a build failure. See the analysis: https://luci-bisection.appspot.com/analysis/b/8774292879682146481



Sample failed build: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8774292879682146481



If this is a false positive, please report it at https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/entry?comment=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fluci-bisection.appspot.com%2Fanalysis%2Fb%2F8774292879682146481&components=Tools%3ETest%3EFindit&labels=LUCI-Bisection-Wrong%2CPri-3%2CType-Bug&status=Available&summary=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F4726188



Original change's description:

> Register gtests written in Rust without Rust static initializers

>

> Static initializers in Rust are not supported and do not work

> correctly on Apple platforms, failing compilation and even crashing

> lld on iOS.

>

> Replace the Rust-side static initializer with the use of linkme to

> collect the registration functions and use a C++ static initializer

> to do the registration of the Rust tests.

>

> Enable rust_gtest_interop_unittests across the bot fleet, though on

> three scenarios the test suite is just an empty placeholder because

> it does not work yet (see the linked bug):

> - Fuchsia

> - Apple-ASAN

> - Windows

>

> Bug: 1466674

> Change-Id: Ic6f7ca5738c6ab0729f49025dd551d1fbdf02647

> Cq-Include-Trybots: luci.chromium.try:linux_chromium_asan_rel_ng

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4726188

> Reviewed-by: Ben Pastene

> Commit-Queue: danakj

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1176793}

>



Bug: 1466674

entry.title: Make LevelDBPersistedTabDataStorage profile keyed
entry.content:
LevelDBPersistedTabDataStorageAndroid should be profile keyed, not

use ProfileManager::GetLastUsedProfile. This CL makes it profile keyed

and uses tab_android->GetProfile() for profile acquisition.

PersistedTabDataConfigAndroid is adapted for the profile keyed storage.

It holds references to the data_id and the LevelDBPersistedTabDataStorageAndroid. PersistedTabDataConfigAndroid

returns a std::unique_ptr for ease of cleanup and avoid the risk of

memory leaks.

entry.title: Register gtests written in Rust without Rust static initializers
entry.content:
Static initializers in Rust are not supported and do not work

correctly on Apple platforms, failing compilation and even crashing

lld on iOS.



Replace the Rust-side static initializer with the use of linkme to

collect the registration functions and use a C++ static initializer

to do the registration of the Rust tests.



Enable rust_gtest_interop_unittests across the bot fleet, though on

three scenarios the test suite is just an empty placeholder because

it does not work yet (see the linked bug):

- Fuchsia

- Apple-ASAN

- Windows



Bug: 1466674

entry.title: Refactor media-device salt utilities
entry.content:
This CL:

* Makes all utilities in //content/browser take a

MediaDeviceSaltAndOrigin parameter instead of separate salt and origin

parameters. This simplifies callsites, which no longer have to unpack

a MediaDeviceSaltAndOrigin. Some of the utilities have a small rename

to avoid clashes with the utilities in //content/public.

* The interface of the utilities in //content/public remains unchanged

because MediaDeviceSaltAndOrigin is a //content/browser type.

However, GetMediaDeviceIDForHMAC() is now callable from any thread.

* Moves utilities which were static methods from MediaStreamManager to

media_devices_util.h|cc, which is a better place for these utilities.

* Moves unit tests for the moved utilities to a new unit test for

media_devices_util. Some simpler tests in the existing browser test

for emdia_devices_util have been moved to the unit test.

* Removes some dead code in MediaStreamManager.

* Turns MediaDeviceSaltAndOrigin into a class. MDSAO was originally

conceived as a struct to make it simpler, but the compiler requires an

out-of-line copy constructor, which eliminates the potential benefit

of aggregate initialization. As a class, MDSAO:

* No longer has a default constructor, to avoid silently

initializing empty salts and origins.

* Has an explicit static method to return an empty MDSAO.

* Its constructor has default arguments for all fields, except

salt and origin, which are the two most basic fields that should

normally be explicitly initialized.

* Has getters to access fields. Prior to this CL, fields were only

set to initialize them since the constructor wasn't always

convenient. Also added setters, although they are used only by

one test.

* Has move constructor and assignment operator.



Bug: 1467546

entry.title: Don't de-duplicate login dialogs with cross-StoragePartition credentials
entry.content:
We de-duplicate dialogs for HTTP auth when credentials have been

provided for an identical challenge. We currently check that this

sharing is not done across profiles, but this is insufficient. We

now, more specifically, prevent sharing across StoragePartitions.



We add tests for the webview tag which is a case of same-profile,

different StoragePartition use.

entry.title: IndexedDB: save a memory allocation when not compressing values
entry.content:
When an IDB value doesn't compress much, we leave it uncompressed and

discard the memory that was allocated to hold the compressed version.

Then later on we allocate new memory to store a copy of the

uncompressed value.



This change keeps the memory that was allocated for the compressed

bytes and uses it for the uncompressed bytes, thus decrementing by

one the number of allocations/deallocations.

entry.title: [phrase-line-break] Implement the phrase line breaking
entry.content:
This patch implements the line breaking logic for the phrase

line breaking.



The logic uses the AdaBoost ML engine in the ICU.



If the line overflows, it falls back to normal line breaking.

If it still overflow, follow the normal CSS logic, as

specified by the `overflow-wrap` property. This behavior is a

feedback from the BudouX team. It's not clear whether this

behavior should be spec'ed or not, it's under discussion at:

https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/9033



Tests are not in wpt because the algorithm is UA-defined.



This patch has no behavior changes as all changes are under a

runtime flag.

entry.title: Solves the Low Cardboard Frame rate on the webXR samples.
entry.content:
Attempts to start a new animating frame by serving any pending

GetFrameData request after scheduling the current frame for processing.

Scheduling the current frame for processing can trigger a GPU wait of up

to 5ms which is half of the total time allowed for a frame at 90fps.

entry.title: [GridNG] Respect a subgridded item's standalone placement
entry.content:
1. Previously, a subgridded item had its placement indices cached even

if its placement occurred inside a nested subgrid's standalone axis.



This caused several issues since a parent grid might try to

accommodate tracks that it was not supposed to be aware of.



2. Adding test coverage to the WPT suite for this issue.

entry.title: Clear media licenses along with dom storage types.
entry.content:
This ensures that [Clear-Site-Data: "storage"] will delete all buckets

and their contents. This is necessary because media licenses are

currently counted as a storage type; if they are not included in

deletion then the buckets themselves will not be deleted.



This is a temporary hack until crbug.com/1434517 is addressed.

entry.title: Add a missing run_loop.Run()
entry.content:
This has "accidentally worked" until now because

`url_loader_factory_.SimulateResponseForPendingRequest` calls

`RunUntilIdle`. However, with the switch to a new Rust-based JSON

parser, parsing happens in a thread pool and is not spotted by

`RunUntilIdle`. Adding the missing `run_loop.Run`, as it appears in the

other tests in this file, makes the test pass again.

entry.title: [tab search] Themify favicons where necessary
entry.content:
Tab Search leans on favicons provided by TabRenderData for the

entries in its tab list. In many cases an image model is returned

that uses a ColorProvier to rasterize on demand, allowing the

favicon to be themed appropriately for a given theme state.



However many favicons are provided as pre-rasterized images directly

from the web content. In these situations the ColorProvider is not

available at the time the favicons are rasterized and the resulting

images are theme-unaware.



To solve the issue of these favicons looking out of place in a themed

Chrome browser, TabRenderData also reports whether a favicon's colors

should be adjusted to better contrast with browser UI. This is

Tracked in TabRenderData::should_themify_favicon.



This is set for many of Chrome's internal pages below

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:chrome/browser/favicon/favicon_utils.cc;l=196;drc=714e1e34e823b7b4bc172fa4bdefee5aaf5e5fff



This CL applies the appropriate theme transformations where necessary

for Tab Search.



Bug: 1457578

Change-Id: I462d7fcbc546f59b6eed1c628947388a4b54ddc8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4725308

entry.title: Fix hover card footer icon from popping in
entry.content:
The tab hover card footer icon was seen popping in when users have a lot

of tabs open due to the icon being painted on another layer. Since the

icon is being painted on another layer, the hover card bubble doesn't

clip the icon when the icon is painted before the footer fully expands.



This CL fixes this bug by having the hover card footer clip the primary

icon view. We paint only the icon that is fading out to another layer

and keep the primary icon view on the same layer as the footer (similar

to how the thumbnail view crossfades the hover card thumbnail image).



Video of footer with fix: https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NTY5MjgzMTQ0MTA5MjYwOHxiMGQ4ZGQ3Zi02MQ



Bug: 1466335

Change-Id: Ib3fb064411e1cd301fff9ac1799c2a6015e95d28

entry.title: [wpt-metadata] Add option to import comments/bugs from TestExpectations
entry.content:
This change adds the option `update-metadata --migrate` to transfer

developer-specified annotations (bugs, comments, and eventually

`[ Skip ]` lines) from TestExpectations to WPT metadata. Such

annotations will remain in flux up to the switch to wptrunner;

`--migrate` will be run right before to automate the transition.



Regular suppressions can be gathered empirically from try build results,

so they are not transferred.



Bug: 1464393

On using ScopedUserManager, in many cases, we keep a typed raw pointer

as next to ScopedUserManager. Also, ScopedUserManager is not reset-table

it is used in std::unique_ptr form.



This CL allows user code to simply write

some syntax-noise/boilarplates.

entry.title: [ProfilesReordering] Add a recovery logic for the profile order pref
entry.content:
A recovery will happen if in the pref list:

- a profile key is missing.

- a profile key is duplicated.

- a profile key is not valid (if the key maps to an invalid ProfileAttributesEntry).



The recovery will reinitialise the pref to the alphabetically ordered

list of profiles per profile local name.

This initialisation will also trigger the first time the pref is created.



Bug: 1466146

Change-Id: I3d0904355f09d45ec4a11b7cbb16dc6b47e7ed97

entry.title: Let provisional frames use a provisional probe sink
entry.content:
For cross-process frame swap, the DevTools agent

host is not connected to a provisional frame until

commit.

However, for local frame swaps, we're currently

not preventing a provisional frame from emitting

events via the DevTools agents associated to its

local root, which may create confusion for the client,

as both the old frame and a new provisional LocalFrame

have the same DevTools frame token.



This CL brings the behavior of a local frame swap

closer to the cross-process case by assigning a new

dummy probe sink to a provisional subframe until it's

committed, and swapping the sink with the old frame

when frame swap occurs.



Bug: 936696, 1455307



See discussion at https://crrev.com/c//4686136 for

additional context.



Change-Id: I3b021b8f2509c1df8d5c2e33918f260e2312ccdc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4713671

entry.title: [scheduler] Pass MainThreadTaskQueue by reference to OnTaskCompleted()
entry.content:
Since graceful shutdown has been moved to the blink scheduler in

crrev.com/c/4349232, MainThreadTaskQueue is guaranteed to remain alive

while running tasks. As a follow-up, this CL changes OnTaskStarted(),

OnTaskCompleted(), and related methods to take a reference to MTTQ. This

also removes the "detached" queue type which was used in UKM as an

unknown type for detached queues.

entry.title: Add color space support to NdkVideoEncodeAccelerator
entry.content:
This follows the model on other platforms where we recreate the

underlying encoder if the frame color space changes. It seems

to work well on newer devices, but not always on older ones.



In cases where it doesn't work, it seems the Android decoder

just assumes a color space instead of saying unspecified.
